history.text: I really enjoyed that movie, I loved Jim Carrey's role as Bruce, it was hilarious!
Jim Carrey pulls off comedy very well
I completely agree, it suits him! Would you watch this movie again?
No, once is enough for me, it was good for a night
how about you?
I can see that, once you watch a comedy once, you don't really want to watch it again! I want to watch more Jim Carrey movies though, forsure!
Morgan Freeman does good serious as well as comedy
Oh I completely agree, Morgan Freeman is one of the best actors of all time! I can see that Bruce Almighty wasn't ranked that well on Rotten Tomatoes, I guess not many people enjoyed it.
Sites like Rotten Tomatoes create or kill the buzz around a movie

So true, Their scoring amuses me sometimes, sometimes they seem completely wrong. Anyways, This movie is pretty old now, but I still hear people talking about it, I wouldn't call it a classic, but it's a quality movie for sure!
That was a very funny scene, I love the drama of Jim falling in love with 2 women. It creates so much drama
Yes, we need a male versus female tension in a good movie
2 women is even better
I agree. I often feel bad for Jim in this movie, yet I shouldn't. He's always having bad luck in the film. Especially when Evan Baxter wins the promotion over him.
That's what make for the plot, wouldn't need to take God to task, otherwise.
Exactly! Bruce is hilarious though. I love how he is googly eyes over Susan, and she doesn't even notice him LOL
Bruce has a good frustrated look, he play it well.
Haha I love this scene, when Bruce is hearing voices from god in his dead. Trying to make everyone happy!
Us mortals need to have experiences like this to empathize with God...
Yup! I love how he automatically answers every prayer with yes! Now he's really in a pickle
Some things prayed for aren't always "Godly"; this make for humor
I agree! I love when Bruce humiliates Evan on air, then Evan got fired! I laughed so hard at that part. I really didn't like Evan!
I love when God apprears!
He was made for us to hate, the perfect anti-hero, and foil.
When Bruce woke up in the hospital, I was so confused at first!
Lost me too for a little while, keep the audience off balance
Yeah! Man though, when the homeless man showed up at the end holding the sign though! I laughed pretty hard at that!
The perfect ending, a homeless man, with a sign..I laughed too.
It was pretty great! I loved Bruce in this movie, I don't think that they could have picked a better actor
Might see it again sometime.
Might join you on that, haha!

uid1response.feedback: Not sure if the other user was real...too agreeable.
